dbms.bplus
Class SecondaryBPlusTree

java.lang.Object
  dbms.bplus.SecondaryBPlusTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class SecondaryBPlusTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Implemenents a B+ Tree that is being used as a secondary index to our DBMS System.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

root

private Node root
The root node.

firstLeaf

private SecondaryLeaf firstLeaf
The first leaf (SecondaryLeaf) of our B+ Tree.

bucketFactor

private final int bucketFactor
The bucket factor.

bucketFactorDiv2

private final int bucketFactorDiv2
The ceiling of the number of bucket factor divided by 2. It is used to define the maximum number of children a node to our B+ tree can have.

keyIndex

private final int keyIndex
The key index.

name

private final java.lang.String name
The name.

                                   InnerNode currentNode,
                                   Node newChild)
Reconstructs inner nodes after new nodes have been created (perhaps from a split procedure). Checks for replition take place too.

Parameters:
key - the current node's key
currentNode - the current node
newChild - the new node

splitInnerNode

private InnerNode splitInnerNode(InnerNode currentNode)
Splits an inner node to two and places half the children to the first and the other to the second. The parent(s) and the appropriate fields are being updated too.

Parameters:
currentNode - the node to be splited
Returns:
the new InnerNode

search

private SecondaryLeaf search(int key)
Searches for a secondary leaf using its key. When the secondary leaf is found it is being returned.

Parameters:
key - the key of the primary leaf - target
Returns:
the desired (SecondaryLeaf) secondary leaf

insert

public void insert(Reference reference)
Inserts a new record to the appropriate position inside the Secondary B+ Tree.

Parameters:
reference - the reference to the leaf that the insertion must take place

splitLeaf

private SecondaryLeaf splitLeaf(SecondaryLeaf currentLeaf)
Splits a secondary leaf to two and then children and the connections of them with their neighbours are being adjusted.

Parameters:
currentLeaf - the current primary leaf
Returns:
the new primary leaf

reconstructTree

private void reconstructTree(SecondaryLeaf currentLeaf,
                             SecondaryLeaf newLeaf)
Reconstructs the tree in order to adjust it to changes that may have been happened (e.g. after secondary leaf's split).

Parameters:
currentLeaf - the current leaf
newLeaf - the new leaf

delete

public java.lang.Object[] delete(int secondaryKey)
Deletes a record (the one with key equal to the given in the parameter) and creates references to the elements of the primary tree that must be deleted.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the references of the records must be deleted.

deleteAllGreaterOrEqual

public java.lang.Object[] deleteAllGreaterOrEqual(int secondaryKey)
Like the delete method except here we delete all the records with key grater or equal to the one given to the parameter.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the references of the records must be deleted.

deleteAllLessOrEqual

public java.lang.Object[] deleteAllLessOrEqual(int secondaryKey)
Like the delete method except that deletes all the records with key lesser or equal to the one given to the parameter.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the references of the records must be deleted.

delete

public void delete(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Object[]> deleted)
It is used to delete records after a deletion made in a primary index. There is a posibility that we have many times the same value for a specific characteristic and this value exist to neighbour leaves. This method checks these leaves too and if such values exist it deletes them.

Parameters:
deleted - the list with the references that were deleted to a primary index

find

public java.lang.Object[] find(int secondaryKey)
Finds a record (the one with secondary key equal to the given in the parameter) and returns it.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the references that must be retrieved

findAllGreaterOrEqual

public java.lang.Object[] findAllGreaterOrEqual(int secondaryKey)
Like the find method except here we search for all the records with secondary key greater or equal to the one given to the parameter.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the records that must be retrieved

findAllInRange

public java.lang.Object[] findAllInRange(int firstSecondaryKey,
                                         int lastSecondaryKey)
Like the find method except that finds all the records in the open gap between the values of the primary keys given to the parameters.

Parameters:
firstSecondaryKey - the first key
lastSecondaryKey - the last key the index of the key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the references that must be retrieved

                             java.util.LinkedList<Reference> oldReferenceList,
                             java.util.LinkedList<Reference> newReferenceList)
It updates the references using the reference lists and according to which records were moved.

Parameters:
recordsMoved - the records that were moved
oldReferenceList - the list with old references
newReferenceList - the list with the new references
